name: GetAsanaProjects
description:
Fetch filtered project records from Asana.

Retrieve compact project records from Asana by applying optional filters for more efficient data handling, especially in large domains. Ensure the 'projects:read' scope is authorized.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Number of projects to return per page, from 1 to 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: The offset token for pagination to obtain the next page of results. Use this token received from a previous request to continue retrieving subsequent data.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: workspace_filter
parameters.description: Specify the workspace or organization to filter the Asana projects.

value_schema.description: The workspace or organization to filter projects on.

parameters.name: team_filter
parameters.description: Specify the team to filter projects in the Asana workspace.

value_schema.description: The team to filter projects on.

parameters.name: optional_fields_to_include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of optional properties to include in the response.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable pretty JSON formatting for debugging. Increases response size and processing time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: return_only_archived_projects
parameters.description: Boolean to filter projects by their archived status. Setting this to true returns only archived projects.

value_schema.description: Only return projects whose `archived` field takes on the value of this parameter.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.description: The workspace or organization to filter projects on.

value_schema.description: The workspace or organization to filter projects on.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: The team to filter projects on.

value_schema.description: The team to filter projects on.
